title: Revert operation is slower than close and reopen in Java editor
description: When I answer "no" to the "do you want to save changes" dialog, then double click on the file in the navigator to reopen it, the file is reopened quickly. However, if I repeat the same steps and then select "Revert" from the pop-up menu in the editor, it takes 15 seconds to replace the contents of the window with the original file contents. This seems odd, since reverting the file contents should not take longer than simply closing and reopening the file.
OB: When selecting "Revert" from the pop-up menu in the editor, it takes 15 seconds to replace the contents of the window with the original file contents.
EB: Reverting the file contents should be as fast as closing and reopening the file.
SR:
1. Open a file in the Java editor.
2. Make changes to the file but choose not to save them when prompted.
3. Double click on the file in the navigator to reopen it.
4. Observe that the file is reopened quickly.
5. Repeat steps 1-4.
6. Select "Revert" from the pop-up menu in the editor.
7. Observe that it takes 15 seconds to replace the contents of the window with the original file contents.
